ARABIC: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَّصْفُوفَةٍ وَزَوَّجْنَٰهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They will recline on couches ranged in rows and We will marry them to dark-eyed maidens.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They would recline on couches set in rows, paired with fair companions (clean of thought and) bright of eye.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The God-fearing shall be reclining on couches facing each other, and We shall wed them to maidens with large, beautiful eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will recline on couches arranged in rows and We shall couple them with maidens with large, lovely eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Reclining on thrones, in rows; and We have wedded them to maidens with gorgeous eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They will recline on thrones Masfufah. And We shall marry them to Hur (fair females) with wide lovely eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Reclining on thrones set in lines, and We will unite them to large-eyed beautiful ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Reclining upon couches ranged in rows; and We shall espouse them to wide-eyed houris.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Reclining on ranged couches. And we wed them unto fair ones with wide, lovely eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: reclining on couches arranged in rows. And We shall wed them to fair maidens with large beautiful eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Reclining on couches ranged. And We shall couple them with maidens wide eyed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They will be reclining on arrayed couches, and We will wed them to big-eyed houris.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They will recline (with ease) on Thrones (of dignity) arranged in ranks; and We shall join them to Companions, with beautiful big and lustrous eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They will recline (with ease) on thrones arranged in ranks. And We shall marry them to Houris (female, fair ones) with wide lovely eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: (They shall be) reclining on couches ranged in rows and We shall wed them to houris (virgins of Paradise) with large wide eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Relaxing on luxurious furnishings; and We will couple them with gorgeous spouses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They will be reclining on thrones lined up, and We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [52:20] [They will be] reclining (muttaki’īna is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the concealed subject of God’s words fī jannātin, ‘amid gardens’) on ranged couches, [arranged] one next to the other, and We will wed them (zawwajnāhum is a supplement to jannātin, ‘gardens’, meaning ‘We will couple them’) to beautiful houris, of wide and beautiful eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Reclining) sitting (on ranged couches) ranged close to each other. (And We wed them) in the Garden (unto fair ones with wide, lovely eyes.
